name: interwork
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I ] to operate together: The methods can only be successful if they can interwork in all the Member States. There's been a lot of talk lately about the two town's bus services and how they interwork.
[ I ]
  computing
  specialized (of computer equipment and software) to be able to connect and exchange information: This powerful application can also interwork with other "sound card aware" applications. Although UNIX systems were available everywhere, they seldom were able to interwork without significant investment of time and effort.
[ T ] to combine different ideas, methods, etc.: He casually interworks stagecraft, tensions in the company, and production realities.
